Module.name: Twitter Anomaly Detection 2.0
Module.Description: Detects Anomalies in Time Series Data. For more information, please visit https://github.com/twitter/AnomalyDetection.

Input.name: Dataset 1
Input.Description: Input dataset with two columns [timestamp, value]

Output.name: Dataset
Output.Description: List of anomalies found in the dataset

Output.name: View Port
Output.Description: View the R console graphics device output.

Arg.name: Max anomalies to return
Arg.Description: Maximum number of anomalies that S-H-ESD will detect as a percentage of the data (default is 0.10).

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.Description: Directionality of the anomalies to be detected.

Arg.name: Alpha
Arg.Description: The level of statistical significance with which to accept or reject anomalies.

Arg.name: Only Last
Arg.Description: Find and report anomalies only within the last day or hr in the time series.

Arg.name: Threshold

Item.name: The median of the daily max values
The 95th percentile of the daily max values
The 99th percentile of the daily max values

Arg.Description: Only report positive going anoms above the threshold specified.

Arg.name: Add Expected Value Column
Arg.Description: Add an additional column to the anoms output containing the expected value.

Arg.name: Longterm Time Series
Arg.Description: Increase anom detection efficacy for time series that are greater than a month. This option should be set when the input time series is longer than a month. The option enables the approach described in Vallis, Hochenbaum, and Kejariwal (2014).

Arg.name: Piecewise median time window
Arg.Description: piecewise_median_period_weeks The piecewise median time window as described in Vallis, Hochenbaum, and Kejariwal (2014). Defaults to 2.

Arg.name: Create Plot
Arg.Description: A flag indicating if a plot with both the time series and the estimated anoms, indicated by circles, should also be returned.

Arg.name: Log Scaling
Arg.Description: Apply log scaling to the y-axis. This helps with viewing plots that have extremely large positive anomalies relative to the rest of the data.

Arg.name: X-axis label
Arg.Description: X-axis label to be added to the output plot.

Arg.name: Y-axis label
Arg.Description: Y-axis label to be added to the output plot. Default is 'count'

Arg.name: Remove NAs
Arg.Description: Remove any NAs in timestamps.(default: FALSE)
